entry.title: Data Analysis
entry.summary:
Data Analysis using Python¶

Analysis of Udacity student data¶

We're working with 3 data files containing information on enrollments, engagement of students with Udacity and submission of projects.

Having a quick browse of the data files and column descriptions I came up with these 5 questions to answer.

  1. Which students most likely to cancel? Which factors have the most impact

div.cell {

  display: -webkit-box;

  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, transparent -40px, transparent 1px, transparent 1px, transparent 100%);
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #90CAF9;
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
  border-left-width: 0px;
  padding-left: 6px;
  background: linear-gradient(to right, #42A5F5 -40px, #42A5F5 5px, transparent 5px, transparent 100%);
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-width: 0;
  padding-left: 6px;

}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;

}

}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;

  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {

  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;

  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;

}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {

  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {

}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {

 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;

}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/

  overflow-y: hidden;

}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  padding: 0.4em;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. We need the 0 value because of how we size */
  /* .CodeMirror-lines */
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;

  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;

  box-orient: vertical;

  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;

  display: -webkit-box;

}

  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {

div.output_area {

.output {

div.output_area pre {

  vertical-align: baseline;

}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;

}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {

}

<style type="text/css">.highlight .hll { background-color: #ffffcc }
.highlight  { background: #f8f8f8; }
.highlight .c { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment */
.highlight .err { border: 1px solid #FF0000 } /* Error */
.highlight .k { color: #008000; font-weight: bold } /* Keyword */
.highlight .o { color: #666666 } /* Operator */
.highlight .ch { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Hashbang */
.highlight .cm { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Multiline */
.highlight .cp { color: #BC7A00 } /* Comment.Preproc */
.highlight .cpf { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.PreprocFile */
.highlight .c1 { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Single */
.highlight .cs { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Special */

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Data-Analysis-using-Python">Data Analysis using Python<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data-Analysis-using-Python">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Analysis-of-Udacity-student-data">Analysis of Udacity student data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Analysis-of-Udacity-student-data">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We're working with 3 data files containing information on enrollments, engagement of students with Udacity and submission of projects.</p>
<p>Having a quick browse of the data files and column descriptions I came up with these 5 questions to answer.</p>
<ol>
<li>Which students most likely to cancel? Which factors have the most impact</li>
<li>Which students most likely to stay? Which factors have the most impact</li>
<li>Ideal time to spend for distinction project rating?</li>
<li>Test account vs other account for days to cancel</li>
<li>Any patterns for join/cancel dates?</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here is a <a href="not yet implemented">link</a> to the description of columns which is necessary to understand what questions we should ask about the data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [194]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline

<span class="c1">#suppress displaying long numbers in scientific notation</span>
<span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_option</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'display.float_format'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">%.2f</span><span class="s1">'</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span> 

<span class="c1">#Tells Jupyter to print results of any variable on a new line so tables will look good</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.core.interactiveshell</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">InteractiveShell</span>
<span class="n">InteractiveShell</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ast_node_interactivity</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"all"</span>

<span class="c1">#Files to load</span>
<span class="n">enrollments_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'enrollments.csv'</span>
<span class="n">engagement_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'daily_engagement.csv'</span>
<span class="n">submissions_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'project_submissions.csv'</span>

<span class="c1">#Read all 3 files into respective dataframes</span>
<span class="n">dfenr</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">enrollments_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">dfeng</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">engagement_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">dfsub</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">submissions_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Exploring the data set</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Find unique number of students and total rows</span>
<span class="n">enrollment_num_rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">enrollment_num_unique_students</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1">#Rename the column to account key so it's uniform in all 3 data frames. Inplace=True replaces the orginal with this df</span>
<span class="n">dfeng</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'acct'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">engagement_num_rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">engagement_num_unique_students</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1">#Find unique number of students and total rows</span>
<span class="n">submission_num_rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfsub</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">submission_num_unique_students</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfsub</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1">#To diplay our results nicely. Create a data frame with named indices</span>
<span class="n">data1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"Total Rows"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s2">"Unique Rows"</span><span class="p">],</span>
             <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">enrollment_num_rows</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">enrollment_num_unique_students</span><span class="p">],</span>
             <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">engagement_num_rows</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">engagement_num_unique_students</span><span class="p">],</span>
             <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">submission_num_rows</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">submission_num_unique_students</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="n">dfdisplay1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:],</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Enrollment'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Engagement'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Submission'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">dfdisplay1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Unique students vs Total Rows"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">dfdisplay1</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>
Unique students vs Total Rows
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[2]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style>
    .dataframe thead tr:only-child th {
        text-align: right;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: left;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
<thead>
<tr style="text-align: right;">
<th></th>
<th>Total Rows</th>
<th>Unique Rows</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>Enrollment</th>
<td>1640</td>
<td>1302</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>Engagement</th>
<td>136240</td>
<td>1237</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>Submission</th>
<td>3642</td>
<td>743</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We see that Unique students for Enrollment and Engagement is off, this should not be the case as all students should be in the Engagement table even if their engagement times are zero.
<br />Begin by taking a look at values of Unique students enrolled  that have no engagement time. 
<br />If we assume the structure (Enrollment:Engagement), we'll take a left join where Enrollment and Engagement don't overlap</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Going to use dfexpl for explore to have a look.</span>
<span class="c1">#Take the Left Join for Enrollments and Engagements first</span>
<span class="n">dfexpl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenr</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dfeng</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1">#Display where num_courses_visited is null, so there are no Engagement values for these particular students.</span>
<span class="n">dfexpl</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dfexpl</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num_courses_visited</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">()]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[3]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>What we find is that the join_date and cancel_date are on the same day for the majority of students. So they could have signed up and cancelled before the Engagement table was populated. This leaves them with a days_to_cancel of zero. This may or may not be an issue depending on what analysis we would like to perform, but finding the reason for this anomoly is a win, and we might use this information later.</p>
<p>We continue and see if there are any more anomolies that don't match our above finding</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Found students that still had a status of "current" but no engagement information</span>
<span class="n">dfexpl</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">dfexpl</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num_courses_visited</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">())</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfexpl</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">days_to_cancel</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[4]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In the above code we find 3 students with no engagement information, and days_to_cancel not equal to zero. The commonality here is that they are all Udacity Test Accounts. This seen from the is_udacity variable, which is True for test accounts. We'll now remove test accounts from all our data and proceed.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Remove all test accounts from data. NT for No Test accounts</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dfenr</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">is_udacity</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNT</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenr</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>1622</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>1640</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We move to the exploration phase. We ask the following question:
<br />How do numbers in the daily engagement table differ for students who pass the first project?</p>
<p>This raises the following problems if we don't filter our data:</p>
<ol>
<li>Data after the project submission will be included</li>
<li>This could also mean we're observing studnet engagement for courses after the first project</li>
<li>Data of different lengths of time are being compared</li>
</ol>
<p>Hence as a first filter we'll remove any students that have cancelled Udacity memberships as well as students who have stayed enrolled more than 7 days. As there is a 7 day free trial period. That will leave us with paid students.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Turn off warnings first</span>
<span class="c1">#pd.options.mode.chained_assignment = 'warn' </span>

<span class="c1">#NT is no test accounts, P is for paid, U is for unique</span>
<span class="c1">#Use .copy() at the end to prevent settingwithcopywarning</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTP</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNT</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">dfenrNT</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">days_to_cancel</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">())</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNT</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">days_to_cancel</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#sorts first by account key then by join date, then only keeps the max join_date</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPU</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTP</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'join_date'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop_duplicates</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">keep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'last'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#how many entries we have now</span>
<span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPU</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#take a look at our entries</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPU</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[6]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>995</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we create a data set with only students (paid students with no test accounts) who have engaged in courses within the first week joining.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Take the Left Join for Enrollments and Engagements</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPU</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dfeng</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#convert date columns to type datetime for easier manipulation</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'join_date'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'join_date'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'utc_date'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'utc_date'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="c1">#dfenrNTPUeng.dtypes</span>
<span class="c1">#Define students who have engaged within 1 week with 0<= engagement <7</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[((</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'utc_date'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'join_date'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">days</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'utc_date'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'join_date'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">days</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Number of entries returned. Without first sorting before dropping duplicates we get an incorrect value</span>
<span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#a snippet of our data</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Out of curiosity we want to know the Average minutes spent in the classroom for these students who have engaged within the first week
To do this we'll average the total number of minutes each students has engaged.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#First groupby account key, then look at descriptive stats for total_minutes_visited</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'total_minutes_visited'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Finding the totals for each student, we'll sum each group and output the descriptive stats we want</span>
<span class="c1">#w for the 1 week set</span>
<span class="n">wsumcol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'total_minutes_visited'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wsum</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wmean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#pandas stdev uses Bessel's correction by default N-1, use ddof=0 for population N</span>
<span class="n">wstd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ddof</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">wmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Sum: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Mean: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Standard Deviation: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Min: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Max: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wsum</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wmean</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wstd</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wmin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wmax</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The maximum time spent on Udacity courses in a week was around 60hrs, which is huge, but plausible. We'll check the student's account to see if the result makes sense.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#find the student with the maximum total mins</span>
<span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">wsumcol</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">wmax</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1">#observe their study times and dates</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">account_key</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">163</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we'll use the same method to find the number of lessons completed instead of time spent.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#First groupby account key, then look at descriptive stats for total_minutes_visited</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'lessons_completed'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Finding the totals for each student, we'll sum each group and output the descriptive stats we want</span>
<span class="c1">#w for the 1 week set</span>
<span class="n">wLsumcol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'lessons_completed'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wLsum</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wLsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wLmean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wLsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#pandas stdev uses Bessel's correction by default N-1, use ddof=0 for population N</span>
<span class="n">wLstd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wLsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ddof</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">wLmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wLsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wLmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wLsumcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Sum: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Mean: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Standard Deviation: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Min: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Max: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wLsum</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wLmean</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wLstd</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wLmin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wLmax</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next we'll use the num_courses_visited column to analyse the number of days students visited a classroom.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#First groupby account key, then look at descriptive stats for total_minutes_visited</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'num_courses_visited'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#list(dfenrNTPUeng1w.groupby(['account_key'])['num_courses_visited'])</span>

<span class="c1">#Create function to count only non-zero values</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">nonzerocount</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">group</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">nzc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">item</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">group</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">item</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">nzc</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">nzc</span>

<span class="c1">#Use .apply to pass the groups to my new function</span>
<span class="n">wNCcol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'num_courses_visited'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nonzerocount</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">wNCsum</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wNCcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wNCmean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wNCcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1">#pandas stdev uses Bessel's correction by default N-1, use ddof=0 for population N</span>
<span class="n">wNCstd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wNCcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ddof</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">wNCmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wNCcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">wNCmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">wNCcol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Sum: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Mean: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Standard Deviation: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Min: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Max: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wNCsum</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wNCmean</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wNCstd</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wNCmin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">wNCmax</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Continuing off the same data set, we'll now find the number of students that pass a certain project and the number that don't pass this project. The project is to do with the New York Subway.</p>
<p>Subway proj lesson key '746169184' or '3176718735'</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [167]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># We'll need to use data from our submissions file as this has lesson keys and records for passing or not</span>
<span class="c1"># We'll use a left join so we don't create any unwanted null values</span>
<span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1wsub</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1w</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dfsub</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1">#dfenrNTPUeng1wsub.head()</span>

<span class="c1">#Find totals then how many passed and didn't pass</span>
<span class="c1">#Note that students who passed either "PASSED" or get "DISTINCTION"</span>
<span class="n">oldKeydf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1wsub</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1wsub</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lesson_key</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">746169184</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">newKeydf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1wsub</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dfenrNTPUeng1wsub</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lesson_key</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3176718735</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1">#combine dataframes so we have a complete set of all of the subway project, ignore index true allows the new index to be in sequential</span>
<span class="n">subwaydf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">concat</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">oldKeydf</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">newKeydf</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">subwaydfPass</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="p">[((</span><span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lesson_key</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3176718735</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lesson_key</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">746169184</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">assigned_rating</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'PASSED'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">assigned_rating</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'DISTINCTION'</span><span class="p">))]</span>
<span class="n">subwaystudents</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">())</span>
<span class="n">subwaystudentsPass</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subwaydfPass</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">())</span>
<span class="n">subwaystudentsNonPass</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subwaystudents</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">subwaystudentsPass</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Students who passed this project: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Students who did not pass this project: </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subwaystudentsPass</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">subwaystudentsNonPass</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Students who passed this project: 647
Students who did not pass this project: 33
</pre>
</div>

</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next we think of some questions to ask about passing students and non passing students.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [168]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Here we implement a (left join where B is null) which could possibly be called a (NOT right join).</span>
<span class="c1">#build data of nonpassing students, step one, an intermediate df with an indicator</span>
<span class="n">subwaydfInd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">subwaydf</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">subwaydfPass</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">indicator</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">how</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span> 

<span class="c1"># Then selecting only non-passing students</span>
<span class="n">subwaydfNonPass</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subwaydfInd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">subwaydfInd</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'_merge'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'left_only'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">subwaydfNonPass</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Questions. Which of the following affects passing or failing a project:</p>
<ol>
<li>Time spent (total_minutes_visited)</li>
<li>Lessons completed</li>
<li>Projects completed</li>
<li>Project ID (lesson_key)</li>
</ol>
<p>To describe our findings we'll use mean, standard deviation, minimum and maximum values.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [193]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Passing statistics for all students</span>
<span class="n">subPtimeCol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subwaydfPass</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'total_minutes_visited'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">subPtimeMean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">subPtimeStd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ddof</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">subPtimeMin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">subPtimeMax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Non-passing statistics for all students</span>
<span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subwaydfNonPass</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">])[</span><span class="s1">'total_minutes_visited'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">subNPtimeMean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">subNPtimeStd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ddof</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">subNPtimeMin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">subNPtimeMax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#To diplay our results nicely. Create a table</span>
<span class="n">data2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[</span><span class="n">subPtimeMean</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">subNPtimeMean</span><span class="p">],</span>
         <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">subPtimeStd</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">subNPtimeStd</span><span class="p">],</span>
         <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">subPtimeMin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">subNPtimeMin</span><span class="p">],</span>
         <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">subPtimeMax</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">subNPtimeMax</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Time Spent by Passing and Non-passing students in hours"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Convert to hours</span>
<span class="c1"># data2a = pd.DataFrame(data2).divide(60).round(2)</span>
<span class="n">data2a</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Make our row and column labels nice</span>
<span class="n">data2a</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Passing Students'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Non-passing students'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Mean'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Standard Deviation'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Minimum'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Maximum'</span><span class="p">},</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#I want to see the percentage difference</span>
<span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">% c</span><span class="s1">hange Non-pass'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Non-passing students'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Passing Students'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Non-passing students'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">data2a</span>
</pre></div>

<span class="n">subNPtimeMax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">subNPtimeMin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">subNPtimeMax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">subNPtimeCol</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">max</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">% c</span><span class="s1">hange Non-pass'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Non-passing students'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Passing Students'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">data2a</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Non-passing students'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We find most students don't complete a project with a range of 0 to 2 and a mean very close to zero. Since the numbers are so low. I had a look at both Passing and Non-passing students.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [172]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Projects completed by Non-passing students'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">subwaydfNonPass</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'projects_completed'</span><span class="p">]][</span><span class="n">subwaydfNonPass</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">projects_completed</span> <span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Projects completed by Passing students'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">subwaydfPass</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'account_key'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'projects_completed'</span><span class="p">]][</span><span class="n">subwaydfPass</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">projects_completed</span> <span class="o">></span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<p>Student 108 completes 2 projects on 2015-02-23 and 2 projects on 2015-03-24. This is plausible as we don't have the information for which projects were completed. We only know that the subway project was completed on 2015-03-24 and incomplete before. This is only an interesting aside.</p>

entry.title: Cards and Stat title
entry.summary:
Cards and Statistics¶

Project to compute statistics from card draws.

We're using a regular 52 deck of cards.
entry.content:
